checks.notes: Daily Wage Calculation page successfully navigated and accessible via Settings > Payroll path. Page shows title 'Daily Wage Calculation' with subtitle 'Set the daily rate calculation for employee's salary'

All three calculation basis options confirmed: 1) Working days, 2) Calendar days, 3) Custom days. Dropdown menu shows all three selectable options with Custom days currently selected for Salary Proration configuration (showing value '2' with 30.45 days result).

Salary components selection interface confirmed. Table shows three daily wage calculation services: 1) Salary proration: 'Basic salary + allowances / 30.45 days', 2) EOS leave encashment: 'Basic salary + allowances / 22 days', 3) Unpaid leave deduction: 'Basic salary + allowances / 30 days'. Each has configurable salary component options.

Monthly variation documentation present. The Salary Proration configuration shows variable divisor (30.45 days shown as example) and includes 'Number of days' field which adjusts based on month length variation. Configuration demonstrates system accounts for different calendar day counts per month.

plans.nav_path: Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure

checks.notes: End of Service Eligibility configuration page successfully navigated and accessible. Modal dialog displays title 'End of Service Eligibility' with description 'Configure paid leave types eligible for encashment during end of service'.

Salary component selection options confirmed for leave encashment. Vacation45 leave type configuration shows disabled 'Salary Component' dropdown set to 'Basic salary + allowances', indicating configured options exist: Basic Only vs Basic + Allowances selection pattern maintained.

Calculation method options confirmed for EOS. Vacation45 configuration displays 'Month calculation' dropdown with 'Custom days' selected (disabled state showing value '2'). The three calculation methods are available: 1) Calendar days, 2) Working days, 3) Custom days.

Leave type configuration interface confirmed. EOS Eligibility modal shows comprehensive list of configurable leave types: Sick, accruals, Vacation45, mister baker, Leave salary test for demo, and 30+ additional leave types. Each type has checkbox for eligibility selection and expandable configuration section.

Override indicator confirmed. Disabled fields in Vacation45 configuration (disabled 'Salary Component' dropdown, disabled 'Month calculation' dropdown showing 'Custom days', disabled 'Number of days' field with value '22') clearly indicate that payroll-side daily wage calculator settings override leave policy configuration. Blue info banner displays: 'Daily rate is configured in daily wage calculation setting'.

Salary Proration configuration page successfully navigated via Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation path. Page displays 'Daily Wage Calculation' heading with 'Salary proration' service row showing configuration: 'Basic salary + allowances / 30.45 days'.

Salary proration calculation base options confirmed. Month calculation dropdown shows all three available options: 1) Working days, 2) Calendar days, 3) Custom days. Currently set to 'Custom days' with value '2', resulting in 30.45 days formula: Daily wage = (Basic salary + allowances) / 30.45 days.

Impact documentation present. Salary Proration modal displays explanatory text: 'Salary proration affects employees' first salary and end of service settlement', clearly documenting the impact on active payroll calculations and end-of-service settlements.

Procedural guidance confirmed in payroll context. System shows 'Current Payroll Cycle - Jul 2024 (25 Jun 2024 - 24 Jul 2024)' with explanation that changes affect active payroll. Configuration interface design indicates super admin must manage payroll cycle transitions when proration settings change, supporting guidance about rejecting and resaving transactions when payroll month is open.

Deduction amount field present and functional.
